intro: Triurocodon, commonly known as the "three-toothed cone," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive triangular or three-lobed leaves, which are often covered in fine hairs. The flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, typically with a single pistil and stamens arranged in a spiral. The plant is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and thrives in moist, shady environments. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and ability to thrive in partial shade.
